item.title: A quick review of C# 10 new language features
item.description: .NET 6.0 and C# 10 are just around the corner, so now is a good time to review some of the most interesting new language features! Record structs 📄 Proposal Records were introduced in C# 9 as a simple way to define data types with value equality semantics, for instance: public record Money(decimal Amount, string CurrencyCode); An annoying limitation was that records were always reference types, but in some scenarios it would have been better to use value types.

item.title: How can I prevent myself from accessing a lambda captured variable or a parameter after I'm done with it?
item.description: We saw last time that you can have your cake and eat it too: You can have a capturing lambda coroutine provided you copy the captures to the coroutine frame before the coroutine’s first suspension point. From that point onward, you use the copies in the frame instead of the original captured variables,

item.title: Announcing manage Tweets endpoints for the Twitter API v2 - Announcements - Twitter Developers
item.description: Today, we are launching new endpoints that enable you to Tweet or delete a Tweet using the Twitter API v2. With the manage Tweets endpoints, you can create engaging, impactful, and creative ways for people to participate in the public conversation. Tweeting is fundamental to how people engage on Twitter, and the new manage Tweets endpoints provide a foundational building block for your use of the Twitter API v2. We heard your feedback about what was missing from v1.1, and have added the ability...
